snippet: The Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) voted to replace the divestment measure with a resolution to encourage “positive investment” in the occupied territories.
abstract: Deeply divided Presbyterian Church decides to toss out a divestment measure for companies that supply equipment to Israel to enforce its control in the occupied territories, becoming the latest American church to do so; decision is the culmination of an eight-year process that was watched intensely by Christians, Jews and Palestinians in the United States and in the Middle East.
lead_paragraph: The Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) voted to replace the divestment measure with a resolution to encourage “positive investment” in the occupied territories.

headline.seo: Presbyterian Church Won’t Divest in Firms Aiding Occupation
headline.main: In Close Vote, Presbyterian Church Rejects Divesting in Firms That Aid Israeli Occupation
headline.print_headline: In Close Vote, Presbyterian Church Rejects Divesting in Firms That Aid Israeli Occupation
